agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Public Education TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Tuesday, April 16, 2019 PLACE: E2.036 CHAIR: Rep. Dan Huberty *The order in which bills are heard is at the discretion of the chair* *Testimony will be limited to two (2) minutes* HB 429 Shaheen Relating to the state virtual school network and a study on digital learning. HB 496 Gervin-Hawkins | et al. Relating to the placement of bleeding control kits in public schools and to required training of school personnel. HB 580 Thierry | et al. Relating to authorizing school districts to reimburse under the Foundation School Program private employers for paid internships provided to certain students in career and technology education programs in the district. HB 662 King, Ken Relating to the recovery of overallocated state funds by the Texas Education Agency. HB 997 Collier Relating to testing for lead contamination in public school drinking water. HB 1269 Holland Relating to the prohibition of student instruction while a school campus is a polling place. HB 1603 Goldman Relating to successful completion of a United States history dual credit course as an alternative to compliance with the United States history end-of-course assessment requirement. HB 2013 Gervin-Hawkins Relating to the implementation of certain rules regarding public school accountability adopted by the commissioner of education or the Texas Education Agency. HB 2019 Geren Relating to parental notice provided by school districts regarding the Internet website containing the sex offender database. HB 2572 Patterson | et al. Relating to establishing a pilot program under which certain public schools may develop a portfolio method to assess student performance in eighth grade social studies and secondary-level United States history for purposes of accountability and qualification for promotion or graduation. HB 2642 Allison Relating to reporting the number of incidents of bullying and cyberbullying in a school district and open-enrollment charter school through the Public Education Information Management System. HB 2818 Lucio III Relating to an Internet online dropout recovery education program for students at risk of dropping out of school. HB 2879 Raney Relating to a competitive grant program to fund promotion of early literacy programs in certain communities in this state. HB 2881 Bernal Relating to establishing resource campuses to improve a public school campus not performing satisfactorily. HB 3008 Talarico | et al. Relating to the establishment of a civic education project fund for supporting student civic education projects and educator professional development related to those projects. HB 3009 Talarico | et al. Relating to civics instruction in public schools. HB 3053 Gervin-Hawkins Relating to the adoption of a healthy and safe school water plan by public schools. HB 3133 Allen Relating to the use of personal leave during school holidays by school district employees. HB 3141 Guillen Relating to providing by contract for a public or private entity to act as the administering authority for the state virtual school network and to the duties of the administering authority. HB 3387 Anchia Relating to abolishing a dissolution committee established to abolish certain county boards of education or boards of county school trustees and appointing commissioners courts to assume the duties of the dissolution committee. HB 3521 VanDeaver Relating to data collection, reporting, and notice requirements for certain educational entities. HB 3628 Goodwin | et al. Relating to creating a special education certification to teach students with disabilities. HB 3712 Bucy Relating to the inclusion of information about the process of voting as part of the social studies curriculum requirements for public high school students. HB 3818 Lozano Relating to the establishment of the work-based learning task force. HB 3836 Bell, Keith | et al. Relating to the selection of instructional materials by a school district or open-enrollment charter school. HB 4270 Wu Relating to the authority of a municipal management district to provide public education facilities and public education-related supplemental services. HB 4342 Clardy Relating to the composition of the board of directors of the Texas School Safety Center. HB 4480 Meza Relating to a study on the use of art therapy in public schools and on art therapy in higher education. HJR 112 King, Tracy O. Proposing a constitutional amendment authorizing Webb County to delegate its authority to manage and dispose of county school land and invest and manage the proceeds from the county permanent school fund. Bills deleted after last posting: HB 1991 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
